name: grppropstr
params: class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3
body: -| wceq(c1, cpr(cop(cfv(cbs, cnx), c2), cop(cfv(cplusg, cnx), c3)))

body.origin:
|- wb(wcel(c0, cgrp), wcel(c1, cgrp))
-| wceq(cfv(cbs, c0), cfv(cbs, c1))
-| wceq(cfv(cplusg, c0), cfv(cplusg, c1))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ Grp ↔ c1 ∈ Grp)
⊣ (Base ` c0)=(Base ` c1)
⊣ (+ ` c0)=(+ ` c1)

⊣ (c2 ∈ 𝕌 → c2 =(Base ` c1))

comment: Generalize a specific 2-element group ` L ` to show that any set ` K ` with the same (relevant) properties is also a group. (Contributed by NM, 28-Oct-2012.) (Revised by Mario Carneiro, 6-Jan-2015.)
